text: Color amarillo, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de tres dedos de grosor (retención decente). Carbonatación media. Textura acuosa y ligeramente efervescente. Aroma a cereal, ligeramente floral y herbal. En boca, mucho grano, mucho cereal, con toques herbales. Ligerísimo amargor final. Escaso regusto a cereal. Flojilla.

0.355 l bottle from EDEKA Preller (Breckerfeld), bottled in February 2017. Clear, pale golden yellow with a medium large, dense, stable, white head. Sweetish, floral, quite grassy-spicy and slightly fruity aroma of fresh grass, pineapple and lemon peel. Slightly sweetish, moderately bitter, grassy-spicy, floral and slightly fruity taste of lots of fresh grass, lemon peel and pineapple with a slightly grainy background, followed by a short, moderately bitter, fairly grassy-spicy, almost peppery and dry finish. Thin to medium body, smooth and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Very crisp and clean classic Pilsener, extremely quaffable and refreshing, overall quite good for the style!

Perfect beer when you need a break from super hoppy IPA's - my go-to year-round beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dose gekauft in einem Whole Food in Washington DC Fruchtiges Hopfenaroma, Mango, Mandarine Voller Antrunk, Sehr bitter, Fruchtnoten im Hintergrund

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear yellow, foamy two finger white head. Nose is fresh and grassy. Taste is classic noble hop spice, with very slight resinous notes. Lovely pils.
Clear, yellow pour with a bright white head. The aroma is lightly fruity and clean. It has a light, crisp body with lively carbonation. The taste is bitter with a dry finish.

Noble spice aromatics. Light and crisp. Flavors of straw and clean malt. The extra hoppiness gives the brew a nice little kick. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear straw golden blonde pour with a thin white head and light sticky lacing .... aroma of lemongrass, pilsner malts, sweet malts, citrusy hops and bready malts .... taste is sweet and of lemongrass, sugary, bready malts, citrusy and lemony .... has a sweet taste and light bitter bite on the backend .... sweet and light bitter finish .... grassy and lemony brew .... great summer pils

12 ounce can from Everetts in South Beloit, IL, served a few minutes out of the fridge in a Christoffel glass. Pours a pale but rather bright clear, lightly bubbly gold with an impressive smooth white head that decays with moderate speed and laces a bit...aroma is more spicy and herb-inflected than most, though pale malt and fresh grass predominate like you might expect (and hope); nicely done but not as potent as I might want...on the tongue its lightly to moderately bitter, becoming rather strongly bitter by the finish, with a very light even malt sweetness running throughout, enough to give it quite a nice balance with the bitterness but never becoming doughy as happens a bit too often with pils...full but refreshing and light-enough body, moderate carbonation. This is pretty solid though for me probably not top-flight.
Gyllengul öl med ett medelstort vitt skum. Doften är citrus, blommighet och säd. I smaken tillkommer en viss gräsighet. En helt okej pilsner.

12 oz can pours a clear golden color with frothy white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is not strong, but has grass, biscuits, honey, and floral hops. Body is light with lively carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel. This is a very refreshing, easy-to-drink pilsener.

Clear, light golden beer with medium white soapy head. Aroma has citrus, biscuits, grass and flowers. Aroma is very mild, however. Taste has grass, flowers, a bit fruits. Medium bitterness. Nice and refreshing pils, strong representative of its genre.
Canned 02.27.17. A: Grain, flower, and lemon. A: See through light yellow body. Fluffy white head. T: Flower, grain, honey, and lemon. P: Quite a bit of resin. O: Nice pilsner.

Delicado aroma a lupulo terroso
Buen aspecto cristalino, poca espuma
En boca ligera, refrescante con final lupulado suave
Clear and pale blond. Flavour has lots of lightly sweet pale malts. Very smooth and fresh.
Clear blonde, with a small white head and some traces of lacing. Nicely carbonated. Nose is fruity and floral. Taste has a nice touch of lemongrass alongside the pilsner malts. Great lager.

Hops and yeast and malty aromas. Pours a pale yellow with a slightly rocky persistent white head. Lacing. Grassy malty flavors with a sharp short finish that is very crisp. Above average carbonation. A solid, well made Pils.

Pours a pale yellow with a big thick white head and laces the glass. Aroma is malt and grass. Taste is sweet pale malt, crackers, grass and citrus hop character. Medium bitterness. Very good; refreshing and true to style.
Draught at En öl- och whiskeymässa 2017. Clear golden, small white head. Grainy malt aroma, grassy hops, some sulphur. Dry, medium bitterness.
From tap at Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival 2017. A clear golden coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, grass, grapefruit and with a bitter finish.

Draft: Mildy fecal hay aroma. Crystal clear golden, medium head, nice lacing. Rich barley malt, full 180 at midpalate to grassy noble hops. Light body, moderate carbonation. Full flavored beery pilsner, worthy of the accolades.

355ml can. Pours out pale clear yellow. Small white head on top. The nose has light malt sweetness and noble hops. Taste - straw like malt and grass herbal notes from the hops. Good bitterness and lively carbonation. A good pils, really liked it.
Aroma is grapes, fizzy tablet, chalk, champagne. Taste is dusty hops with some grapes. No body. Lame.

12 oz can pours a golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of citrus, sweet malt, light floral. Light bodied, nice refreshing beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a can into a pint glass to drink. The beer had an extremely light and clear gold color with rising bubbles and a foamy white head with good retention and modest cling and lacing. Its aroma featured floral and light citrus hops notes, with some touches of pine, barley, and grain, and a bit of toasty malt. The taste was a bit grainy and sour with a bitter pine and earthy mix, along with very subtle malt. It had a lively and bubbly mouthfeel with good carbonation, but a thinner and fairly dry body, without much mouth presence.

Draft in some shitty bar in a shitty mall with shitty weather outside in non-shitty Hawaii. Aroma is noble hops, very fragrant and perfume-like. Crisp and clean drinking, slight citrus and herbal. Very nice!
At BKL - golden color, white head. taste is slightly fruity, faint sour. moderate bitterness, very quaffable. Nice

Tap at SF Beer Week Opening Gala.

Pours pale yellow.
Aroma: Nice soft grassy hops, 
Light body, nice malt backbone, good bitterness, very balanced and drinkable.
Dry and soft, yet not boring
Getreidiger trockener Antrunk, sehr mild. Moderat würzig, laff. Muss nicht. 6/7/7/7//6
Bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy, a bit lemony, leafy. Taste is grainy, lemon, quite simple. Grainy aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Meh.

Draft... Pours clear and yellow with a mid-sized, creamy, white head. Good retention. The aroma is too faint to matter  Im going with their reputation here and assuming its not offensive. Light to medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation. This is not hoppy enough for me as far as pilsners go, but the flavor is perfectly balanced and washes down buffalo wings down like theres no tomorrow.

Tasted on draft and bottled at the 2016 Czech Heritage Fest. Crystal-clear golden colour, sudsy white foam, lasting with lace. Delicious true-to-style Pilsener aromas and flavours: crisp grains, grassy, herbal, earthy, citrusy, black pepper spice, mineral water essence. Light body, strong carbonation, bone-dry finish, thirst quenching, lingering noble hoppy aftertaste. A masterpiece.

Lata. @ Maquila bar Sevilla 29/01/2017 Canned:11/01/16
Color amarillo, sabor maltoso dulce, cuerpo medio

355ml bottle. Clear, yellow-ish, pale golden colour with average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, snow-white head. Slightly floral, grassy hoppy aroma, a minimally strawy touch. Taste is slightly citrusy hoppy, grassy and minimally floral, hints of lemon zest, hibiscus, lemongrass, pale malty basis. Light, clean, refreshing. Nice.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Smaczny pils w niemieckim stylu. Profil czyściutki jak złoto.

bottle from Tall Boys beer market, Leeds. Golden colour. Aroma is herby, grass, floral, corn. Taste is malty, zesty, the same as aroma. Food pairing with Joe&Sephs mature cheese popcorn. Popcorn helps for more higher bittery.
Golden color, white head with good retention. Aroma is light citrus with some floral hints. Flavro is light malty, some earthy notes. Light body in the final with some maltiness.
From Labirratorium. Ik Teku glass. Playing Forge of Gods. Just slightly hoppy, without losing the pils character like in other hoppy pilsens, providing just some grassy notes. Crushable

Pale golden color with a lively head of creamy clean white foam. Clean malt base lends to a light biscuit aroma and flavor letting lightly spicy and earthy hops to shine through. A unique west coast/German hybridized pilsner.
Bottle. Clear golden in coour, nice white head. Aroma is malt and herbal hops. In taste lightly sweet, crisp with moderate bitterness. Clean, crisp nice pils.

Draught @ [ Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival 2016 ] @ Malmömässan, Mässgatan 6, Malmö, Sweden 21532. [ As Firestone Walker Pivo Hoppy Pils ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, pale malt, fruity malt, moderate hoppy, grass, fruity hops, crispy hops. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, pale malt, grass, citrus, fruity crispy hops. Fresh and balanced. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160401]
 8-3-7-3-15

How: Draught.
Where: SBWF 2016.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, citrus, grass, malt.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Citrus, malt, some fruit.
On tap @ Flying Barrel. Pale hazy yellow with a small white head. Malty and hoppy tones. Malt, fruit,hops and bitterness. Medium body with a nice bitter sweet finish.

Pours an almost clear golden with a fairly large frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, rye bread, orange zest, minerals. Taste is very well balanced between fruitiness and earthy, floral notes and a moderate bitterness. Mouthfeel is crisp and light bodied with medium carbonation.

Om tap at Sherlocks. Clear golden with white head. Aroma is clean, malty and slight herby grassy. Taste is clean and crisp, malt and grain with a touch of herby grassy hops leading to a fairly sweet finish. Good stuff.

Bleek blond troebel bier met wit schuim. Weinig geur, wat mout en licht hoppig. Smaak: licht moutzoetig en bitter, wit van pompelmoes en onrijpe banaan. Goede balans. Aangename koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitter, citrus.

Bottled @ Broken Dreams. Clear straw golden, dense mid-size white head, rich lacing. Hoppy grassy and floral nose. Crisp mouthfeel, soft carbonated. Dusty grassy taste with floral bitterness, bread and grains. Nice thirst quencher!

Draught at Man in the moon. 
Pours clear golden with a white head. 
Balanced bitter and clean pilsner with a touch of modern hops.
Bottle @ 19hundra, Ängelholm. Pours a clear golden colour beer with small head. Hoppy and malty with a crispy feeling. Dry finish

Tap @ sbwf. Pours a clear yellow color. Dry aroma of fresh bread, grass, mango, hay, flowers. Crisp taste, low to medium body. Taste of bread, hay, grass, mango, citrus. Bitter finish with earthy notes and lingering bread.
Bottle at home. Aroma is grainy malt, floral hops, fruity notes, grass. Flavour is medium bitter. Body is medium. Nicely crisp and bitter hopped Pils.
Sample at SBWF 2016. Crisp smell, minerals, pale bread and grass. Similar taste. Crisp and clean. Very nice!

Keg at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Clear pale golden, firm mid sized head. Unusual perfumy floral nose with canteloupe and citrus. Mid sweet with light-medium body and clean, somewhat rounded mouthfeel. Grassy and fruity with some grains. Lightly resiny mid bitter finish. Feels more like a Belgian attempt than a central European. Decent, but not exceptional.

Colore giallo dorato, pallido; sottile schiuma bianca, carbonazione sempre ben visibile. Aroma molto fresco e dal profumo floreale; sottili note di miele e agrumi, con un persistente profumo erbaceo nel retrolfatto. Qualche nota pepata, con un pizzico di sedano. In bocca si viene raggiunti dal carattere classico di malto, ma ci sono essenzialmente due combinazioni di sapori in questa birra: dolcezza di malto Pilsener, seguita dallamaro di luppolo, con note piccanti e finale asciutto. Ottima bevibilità grazie al corpo leggero, ed una carbonazione elevata.

Aroma is clove , lemon grass, honey and caramel. Taste is light sweet malts , caramel, honey, citrus, lemongrass and a slight earthiness. Appearance is a clear straw with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

Bottle.

A- Grassy, spices, pine.

A- Golden color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Grassy, slightly hoppy, pine.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, slightly bitter finish.

O- Decent stuff. Definitely not your typical pils. A nice hoppy touch that reminds me a lot of Victory Prima Pils.
Can. Clear pale gold pour with white head. Aroma is quite grainy, very grassy, tame. Taste is grainy, very mild, soft grassy notes. Palate is light bodied, dry, good carbonation. Nice.

Pours a clear pale golden with a medium white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is peppery and slightly grassy. Taste is dry and moderately bitter, offers more peppery/lightly esrthy hops over a soft malty base. Crisp cereals for the most part but it does feel a little doughy at times, too. Body is medium, carbonation moderate. A fine hoppy pils with a good hoppy bite! This would certainly be a go to if it was local/more available to me.

Bottle to glass. Pours a clear, rich yellow with a spotty white head, almost eggshell. Aroma of hay, very mild florals, apple, pear. Toasted cereal throughout the flavor with some nondescript fruits peeking through. Some skunk towards the finish which didnt exactly leave me begging for more....still, not bad.

Love the brewery, but this is a fairly limp effort. Not Pils like in any real form, more like a hopped up lager with out the character of body of the German/Czech classics or even some of the new world Kiwi varities. Decent lawnmower beer, but will pass next time.
Can into pint glass. Pours a clear straw straw colour with white head. Aroma is faint stone fruit and toast. Taste is toasty malt and a bittersweet fruitiness.
Canned. Cant believe I didnt rate this before. One of the 6 I got was skunked but still when this is on it has it all.

Bottle to pint glass
Consummation: Berries, wheat, light malt and a skunky ending
Adjunct: Clear, light yellow with a thin white head; light sour lemon, pepper; pdg for a pils

5.3%ABV. Pilsener.

Poured out yellow. 4ºSRM.

Nose is lightly beery, citrus with the sour and the hoppy freshness.

Mouthfeel is light and soda like. Palate has pale malt but not much sweetness, there is cereal, water biscuits. Hops are bitter and noble-like. Some very light spicy notes. Overall nicely balanced.
Golden appearance with a hoppy aroma. Fruity notes in the body with a bubbly clean finish.

Can (12 oz) bought at Craft Beer Cellar (Waterbury). Clear pale yellow-golden with a small white head, moderate retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is of herbal hops - more herbal/grassy than hoppy - fresh cereals and delicate peppery notes. Taste is herbal with fresh bready cereals, hints of sweetness but definitely not too much, mild peppery presence and light bitterness. Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel, Dry and herbal finish. A lovely quencher with a delicate but complex malt profile and immense drinkability.

This is a tough one for me to rate. I drink mainly IPAs and stouts - with most having bold flavors. Due to this the pilsner seems very mild and weak in flavor.?

Aroma - got some grass upfront. More I focused on aroma, more I was getting a lemongrass feel. 

Appearance: Very light, clear golden color with carbonation bubbles visible. Decent head with lacing that lasted until the end. (Note: This was poured in a tulip as I do not have the normal glassware for a pils. )

Taste: Very light, crisp. Has a bit of spicy hop feel on the tongue. Has that floral hops feel, with a bit of lemon zest. Slightly bitter at the end. Light cracker style taste too.

This probably deserves a higher rating, but...it is based off of my tastes. I will say this is probably one of the best (if not the best) pilsners I have ever had. I probably would drink again on hot summer days - or if I am eating light seafood or mild food pairings.

Canette de 12 oz achetée chez Beverage Warehouse (Winooski, VT). Arôme: Légère odeur dhoublons herbacés. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dhoublons herbacés avec une pointe de céréales et de citron. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est plein avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #7018)

Pint on tap at Beer Revolution in Edmonton pours a clear golden color with a small white head leaving a few spots of lacing on the glass. Aroma is light citrus and grass with some grains. Taste is a light citrus and spicy hop bitterness with a malty sweetness. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall a nice touch with the extra hops. Recommended for those who like pilsner , but want a little more flavor.

Draught at En Öl- och Whiskymässa, 2016. Clear yellow, big white head, dissipates slowly leaving lots of lacings. Aroma is malt, corn, grass, slight metallic, dusty, hoppy. Taste is medium bitter with pale malt, grass, slight crackers, slight new world hoppy but mostly grassy hoppy as the style suggests, good dry bitterness in the finish. Light to medium body, medium carbo, sharp bubbles and crisp texture. Good one.

Aroma is metallic, corn, mold, earthy hops, eh. Appearance is golden yellow, white head, slight haze. Taste is metallic, earthy hops, corn, not that great. Mouthfeel is light body, light carbonation, metallic corn aftertaste. Overall, I was expecting much better.

Draught at Craft Beer Market, VancouverPale blond color. It has a mild aroma of hazelnut, some wheat bread. The mouthfeel is very dry, not much flavor, correct bitterness, with no noble hop quality.Not very good.
On tap at Craft Beer Market on Firestone Walker event. Aroma is flowery hops, slightly yeasty. Taste is similar, crispy. Dry, hoppy bitterness aftertaste. Refreshing, good beer.

Draft at The Answer. Medium gold, clear, nice head. Aroma of spicy and floral hops, some crackery malts. Flavor matches. Nicely clean for the most part. Hops not as aggressive as I had been hoping, but hardly a bad beer. Liked it.

Poured into a sample glass at WilliBrew: Pours clear yellow / golden with a decent fluffy white head. Aroma of cracker malts, pils malts and other German malts, light citrus, noble hops. Taste is dry, crackers, bread, grass, light citrus, lightly floral. This is a really tasty light beer that would be a staple for the summer.

Can into pils glass, clear bright golden color with off-white head. Aroma notes of grainy malt sweetness, bread and light citrus hops. Taste adds more grass, tropical notes and biscuit. Light body, moderate-heavy carbonation, crisp, tad dry with light citrus bitter finish. Nice pils with some balanced extra citrus.

Sample at WOBFest 2016. This is a pilsener I could drink. Has the same body and coloring of a regular old domestic, but they added some hops bitterness and a little best of lemon citrus to make this very drinkable.
Clear golden pour with some head that stuck around for a while. Aroma and taste of grain, malt and hops. Not bad when on a rooftop in Vegas enjoying the nice weather.
Waited a long time to try this. Served with a fluffy white head and lots of lace. Aroma is fresh lager and hops. Flavor is similar to nose very fresh clean bittersweet. Extremely drinkable.

For my palate a hoppy Pils is a supremely tasty Pils. Firestones Pivo has everything I want from an American rendition of the German-style Pils. Yellow-gold pour with creamy white suds. Bread, grass, and bright citrus aromas. Excellent balance for a hop-forward take on Pils. Clean malt at the start. Bitter earth in the follow-up. The feel is just a bit sticky toward the finish, but the overall texture is lively and bright from the carbonation and crisp hops. Yup, this is how I like my Pils.

Cam from Callans consumed in the parents garden.
Yellow to golden with a generous white head, carbonation well evident. 
Nose is bready malts, straw, lemon rind, toasted grain, light spice.
Taste comprises pale malts, bread dough, vanilla,  light floral hop bite, tangerine, citric sherbets. 
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, semi drying close with a hoppy linger.
Decent hopped up pils.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Poured from bottle. Clear yellow, white head. Aroma, little grassy, light hops.
Taste was grainy, spicy and dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2016 355ml can from BrewDog. Extremely pale yellow colour with a dense frothy white head, collapsing to a slim head after a couple of minutes. Aroma is hoppy, grapefruit, grassy/straw notes, floral, soapy, dusty. Bittersweet flavours, grassy hops, citrus fruit, malt, grains. 
A good pilsener but really hoppy for the style, I know that was the whole point of this particular beer but it seems closer to a pale ale at this point. Nice idea though, I liked this, but I think Ill stick to actual pilseners when I want a light, crisp beer.

bottle from local bottle shop, clear golden pour with a white head. keep in mind that this is just a pilsner. i would stop drinking craftbeer is every pilsner was like this. its crisp, malty, citrussy, hoppy, mouthfeel is super refreshing with crisp minerals and summer cut grass. best pilsner i have had?

Saazz and grass aroma. Clear with a thin white head. Crisp clean with bits of biscuit. Smooth and super clean flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a can;Fantastic beer; very drinkable; great balance of toasted malts and hops; perfect for summer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Tanakaya. Pours a clear straw with a finger of white head that lingers. Very light grainy nose, but nothing really stands out. Nice grassy hops on the palate with good carbonation and clean, bitter finish. Not bad.
355ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear pale yellow color. Very weak aroma. To be honest cant get any aromas. Perfume, some rubbery hops in taste. Dunno what it is. No emotions sparked.

355ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut!
Sweet light-malt and fruity estery aroma, pleasant hoppy hints - has more "ale" character than the "brown ale" we just had! Watery palate, flatish. Dull grains taste, sweetish, but lots of bitter hops, Drying and lacking balance. A bit aggressive all in all.
Bottle (from beergium). Pours yellow. Aroma is sweet, citrus, soapy. Flavor is sweet and bitter, soapy, citrus, malt. Overall: ok.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 Bottle shared by Mart. Clear pale yellow beer, white head. Nose is hoppy, malt, grainy notes and grass. Flavor is some oranges, grass, malt, some dusty notes. Oranges in the finish with grassy notes. Crisp.
Very pale golden. Light dry hoppy grassy nose. Super drinkable, lovely dry hoppy pils.

Can courtesy of Geraint and Helen (cheers you two!)consumed at home Sunday 22nd May 2016 at home whilst cooking Haddock, Chorizo and Chickpea Stew.  Light gold actually its straw coloured with a white head. Fruity nose, some grassy hop and a bit of grain shows. Good bittersweet balance, a little minerally then the hops push through with a bit of spice and floralness going on, like it, in fact I fair gulped away at this whilst cooking.  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

Can, new in Japan. Pours a clear straw gold, lots of bubbles, soapy white head. Big crackery, wheat aroma, lovely bright citrus, lemon, a hint of lime and something like yuzu. Nice balanced mix of malt and hop, lemongrass, a light spice at the end. Its insanely drinkable, gentle carbonation, clean hop finish, lingering toasty malts. Very happy to finally get my hands on this.
Bottle. Clear pale yellow with a white head. Smells a bit like a belgian pale ale, flowery perfume, sweet honey and caramel. Tastes the same, with some tropical fruit added to the mix.
Firestone has a name for making drinkable IPAs, but this makes a statement about lagers, being both hop forward and finely balanced.
Tap at Keyaki. Floury, wheaty, good stuff. Very easy drinking, nice. Best of the lot.

Draught at Keyaki. Now that is a winner, lovely balance between malt and floral hops,super crisp, notes of lemon, lovely dry finish. Great stuff, could drink loads of it, fairly classic yet outstanding hoppy pils!

10th May 2016Can. Lightly hazy gold beer, thin white head. Palate is light, dry and minerally crisp. Dry pale malts, some lager character. Dry floral bitterness. Bitter citric pith. Dry and bitterish finish. Founds this a bit rough edged.

Can from Meditrina. Pure clear pale gold with lasting head and lace. Nice grassy floral hop crackery malt aroma. Wicked clean light crackery malt with grassy dry finish and without excessive lingering bitterness. Very light and lively. Nailed it.
Can. Crisp, grassy, citrusy. Ends dry. Really hoppy, yet rather true to style. Nice.
Pours a straw from a bottle, floral/citrus/tropical fruit notes in the nose, but doesnt mesh well with the pilz crisp profile, which on its own I could see being very nice. Meh.

Can @ Home. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, grassy hops, little citrus. Flavor is light sweet, malt, grassy hops, citus, lemonpeel. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 230416
Can. Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, hops, citrus, light zesty citrus, light herbal, quite bitter and dry finish.
Can. Nice head with good duration. Color is pale golden. Aroma and taste are bitter hops, grass, straw and malt. Nice bitter finish.
Can. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Pale yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 220416

On tap @ Lindas. Pours clear pale yellow with medium white head. Aroma is light grassy hops, just a hint of grain. Taste is crisp, clean lager malt, slight note of corn; otherwise the hops are allowed to shine - fresh, grassy, with a light trailing vegetal note. Very juicy and hoppy for the style. Clean, super drinkable, perfect on a warm day.

April 16, 2016 - on tap at Beer Park. Clear golden pour with some head that stuck around for a while. Aroma and taste of grain, malt and hops. Not bad when on a rooftop in Vegas enjoying the nice weather.

A bitter finish to a decent larger. It suffers a lot of the problems associated with larger (overly carbonated) but has a decent kick at the end. The drink however starts to feel watery towards the end.
Sample @ Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival 20160402. Malty, hoppy, fruity, grassy, finish is bitter.
Can from Coppers, Newcastle. Very pale straw coloured with a thin white head. It has a grassy and gentle citrus flavour followed by a bitter-sweet herbal, smooth fruity finish. Nice.

Very clear golden coloured body with hints of copper and pure orange, all with a frothy, two centimetre tall pure white head. Aroma of fresh malt, very light hops, citrus and a touch of fresh grain. In recent years Ive become more impressed with American breweries making traditional, to-spec Czech and German-style pilsners. These arent easy brews to make, especially without Americanizing them, so a good one is much appreciated by me. Thats why I really enjoyed Firestone Walker Pivo Hoppy Pils, which, despite the name, is not an IPL or especially hoppy for the style. Spicy, dry, clean and refreshing  thats what I want in a pilsner.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a pilsner glass. It was bottled on 4/13/15 and cost $2.85 ($0.24 per ounce). 

Appearance: Pale lemon-skin yellow hue with slight cloudiness. Pours to a small, bright white, foamy head which laces and retains very well. Spastic carbonation is always visible.

Smell: Spicy/slight skunky Noble hops though pilsner malt is quite prominent and creates for a graham cracker-like scent too.

Taste: Theres essentially just two flavor combinations happening in this palette: raw pilsner maltiness up front and spicy hops with dry bitterness up on the backend. It simple and repetitive, yes, but because these flavors are so enjoyable I never get tired of them. The malt character is classic, cracker-like in nature (a combination of wheat and graham crackers if that makes sense) with the Noble hops imparting a strong spicy sensation on the finish. I detect a hint of lemon lollipop, though that could be due to the fact this bottle is rather old at nearly 3 months (oxidation). Though the hops dont seem to have faded at all  I really like the zesty flavor they create. Overall, this is a more-than-solid pilsner palette that can be enjoyed by anyone.

Drinkability: What makes for a good pilsner isnt just the flavor, but also the easy drinkability. Firestone Walker Pivo Hoppy Pils is exactly what you want in the style: a crisp, well-carbonated mouthfeel thats in no way thin or abrasive. Refreshing while in the mouth, it does leave a bit of a spicy/starchy aftertaste, though it fades rather quickly and is tolerable anyway. Perhaps a bit big at 5.3% ABV since thats a bit too heavy to be considered a session beer by most drinkers. Still, no one is going to have a problem throwing back a few of these on a hot day. The fact its also available in cans is a great selling point.

Score: 8/10

The first thing that hit me, (and made me smile), was the color. Stout is my preferred style of beer so I naturally drink a lot of dark, heavy, full-bodied ales. This one poured out a solid 3 SRM, which brought a smile to my face. Well done guys. Firestone Walker recommends drinking this no more than 120 days from their "Bottled on" date and I cracked this bottle open on day 144, (an oversight to be sure). So there wasnt as much carbonation as would be expected but it still put any of the big 3 adjunct lagers to shame. The nose was pleasant and subtle. The hops were there, but not in an in your face (Simcoe®) kind of way. My first impression of the taste was balanced. You can taste the hops and the malt, but neither one is over powering or competing with the other. Very light mouth feel. As a stout drinker Im tempted to say it was watery. But I dont think thats accurate. In fact when I decided to write this review I had to really focus on the style of beer I was drinking, and make sure Im not judging it by another styles standards. For what this beer was crafted to be, it delivers. In my humble opinion it hits all the benchmarks of a German Pilsner, (with a twist). The marketing seems to be that this is a hoppy pilsner, and while that is accurate, it is also misleading. The bitterness is well balanced in this beer. The hops are there, but Im not sure I would define this as a hop forward or even hoppy beer. Its a well balanced German Pilsner with some interesting layers. Very enjoyable beer.

Flavorwise, in addition to the malt backbone that plays a big traditional lager role, the Bavaria-sourced Hallertaus impart a grassy, earthy and spicy character thats a very welcomed change, in my opinion, to the run-of-the-mill American macro lagers out there. The beer pours a beautiful, pale yellow/gold with a nice head of perfectly sized, egg-shell white bubbles that settle to a quarters finger-width above the glass and demonstrate a nice retention. In body, the beer is nearly as clear as water with no particles and a steady stream of bubbles dancing through it. On the nose, the beer smells of buttery cracker malt with a solid bitter, herbal scent with a touch of mint and fresh grass. On the very edges of the nose stone fruit can be sensed alongside fresh pine needles. On the tongue, the beer tastes superbly bitter upfront with wonderful balancing bready sweetness. Soft acidity from the hops wets the sides of the mouth and provides a very, very light pucker. There is even a soft touch of earthy salinity in the beer. In flavor the beer tastes of bitter grass and herbal hops, mellowing into a smooth butter cracker malt. The finish is blend of smooth white bread and grassy bitters with just a touch of gooseberry, salt, and a mineral-earthy flavor. This is a grassy bitter beer at heart, but it has a wonderful balance of sweet malt and mineral-like flavor. In the mouth, the beer feels on the heavy side of light in body with a creamy carbonation and a definite prickly-crisp mouthfeel that leaves the mouth refreshed and tingling with saliva in the cheek pouches and a slight neutrality throughout the rest of the beer. Overall, this is a superbly hoppy pilsner with awesome subtle complexity. The beer is refreshing and perfect to nearly session.

text: 12oz bottle, courtesy of Firestone Walker. Thanks! Pours a brilliantly clear straw color; firm, foamy white head thats constantly replenishing from the effervescence. Grassy, herbal hop character in the aroma, with a quiet, hay-like malt character; very dry and lean. Medium-light body; effervescent CO2; crisp, dry, and, again, quite lean; grassy and herbaceous hop character with hay and a slightly grainy malt core; nicely dried out; theres just a touch of astringency here, particularly near the finish, that sticks on the palate and takes away from this a touch. Ive had this beer a few times now, and Ive always enjoyed the first half and then failed to order a second pint. Lasting bitterness in the finish with, again, a touch of lingering papery astringency.

Bready malts, Pils malt, and some gentle doughy qualities. Crisp, dry, firmly hopped. Nice. Initial is lighter end of the fold, a touch of body keeps it honest. Dry earthy hops meet bready and straw grainy malts. Clean gentle bready sweetness progresses into a more dry and slowly growing earthy and Noble hop dry bitter quality. Gentle spice, gentle citrus compliments. Crisp cool clean malty qualities, earth, spice, dry earthy and grassy hops. Earthy, floral, twist of mellow citrus again compliments. The hop profile here is both complex and progresses through the pint. Well done!

[ Bottle ][ Costco Carlsbad ][ 12oz x 5 ][ ~$1.50 ea ][ Globe + Pils Flute ][ 5/9/14 ]
>> Whoa baby has this beer improved. I was skeptical that anyone on the West Coast, or simply just not in Pennsylvania, could ever make an American pilsner like Victory. Then along came Heater Allen, but there beers are impossible to find so big whoop. So I had high hopes for Pivo. First taste was a bust. Now that it is a regular offering from FW, someone has done some major recipe overhaul and made this into a baller level pilsner.The pour is crystal clear golden straw. Soapy, large white foam with good lacing. Nose is super sharp and fresh lemongrass, white grapefruit peel, ultra fresh lemon zest, fresh lawn trimmings. Taste is oh man, so crisp and crackery, ridiculously addictive grassy hop bomb bitterness. Palate is long and quenching, grassy long finish is addictive. Can kill 4 of these bottles in one sitting with no problem. Perfect crushability. This is about to become a staple in my household. Thank you 3fourths for inspiring me to retry this one. 8/4/8/5/16=4.1
Original Rating: Tap at Churchkey. Clear yellow pour. Weaker head to none. Nose is mild butterscotch, pear, sweet esters. Odd. Taste is sudsy, soapy, a tad chemical. Not so great. 6/3/5/3/11=2.8 3/25/13

On tap at the Common Table. Clear golden color with a white head. A very nice hoppy pilsner. I get a lot of grass and citrus character as well as some nice biscuit malt. There is a hint of sweetness but the hop flavor really comes through nicely. Low bitterness. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Tap at Congregation Ale House Long Beach.  Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is Pils malt, light DMS notes, spicy Noble hops.  Flavor is malt forward with light hops and bitterness, a clean lager character and a dry finish.  Medium body and carbonation.

(Fraught) deep amber, wispy fine offwhite bubbles. Nose of cream, earthy hops, light caramel, malty. Taste is nice and malty, oats, very smooth, nice natural carbonation in the mouthfeel, lightly earthy but not offensive at all. Light caramel linger, maybe the most drinkable pilsner in recent memory. Near perfect palate finish.

Pours a nice light amber with white foamy head that quickly disappears, leaving thin film and lots of lacing.
Faint hop on the nose. Not much else. Lightly bitter flavor, refreshing hops and a hint of corn and hay.
Medium body, moderate carbonation.
Decent pils; reminiscent of days in Eastern Europe.
Not my go to style, but I certainly wouldn't turn one down!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light yellow in color.  I dont get much hops on my palate but this is bright and easy to drink with a great fizz to it.  This and the 805 are really great beers to start an evening with.  A little metallic-ness on the back end is the only note that I dont connect with.

Golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of toast, grassy hops, pils malt, some lemon and citrus. Taste of toasty malts, grass, light sweetness, and a slightly hoppy finish.
Light pils aroma, yellow in color... Flavor is light crisp, decent pilsner flavor... Solid for the style

Draught at the Paso Robles Taproom. Good grassiness and light lemony aroma. Clean & pretty, glowing yellow, little head. Smooth and delicious grass/hay initial; mid has a mild hop character and light sweetness / very smooth and lightly malty finish. Thin body. A very solid pils. The Hallertauer is really good in this one.
Clear straw color. Thin white head. Dirt and musty aroma. Wet straw and grassy flavor finished with a punchy bittering hop note.

A worthy beer for my 2000th rate! It pours a very clear golden yellow with a white head. The aroma is dry, biscuity and grainy with some eucalyptus, herbals, and noble hops. Aromatic! A little apple cider The flavor is noble hops spice and dry with some mild notes of honeyed malt. Very drinkable and super tasty. Awesome pils.

Draft. Poured a clear copper color with an average frothy white head that was lasting and produced excellent lacing. Good moderate to heavy complex hop and malt aroma. Medium to full body with a dry slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a solid beer and one of the best of style I have had.
Draft.  Enjoyable pilsner.  Not overly hopped or musky, medium body for this style.  Refreshing but not light, stands up well with food.

Sampled at 1702 Tucson; December 2012
Arrives from the tap with a frothy, one finger thick, pale head that leaves lots of layered lacing on the sides of my glass as I quickly quaff this beer. The beer is a bright gold color that shows a pale gold, brilliantly clear hue when held up to the light. The aroma has a pale cracker like grain character to it up front followed by a floral, slightly citrus like, and lightly herbal hop character that picks up steam the more I dig into the nose.

Dry, crisp, and clean up front, an herbal, slightly woody hop character kicks in towards the middle and finishes with a solid bitter hop bite. The bitterness is clean and biting from the get go, with the beer being pretty dry the hop focus is on the bitterness and herbal character, but there is a touch of lemon like citrus character here. The beer is quite light bodied and refreshing without being overly thin; it is incredibly quaffable and almost seems to disappear from my glass without me even trying.

This is a really nice Pilsner, I could easily consume a whole lot of this over a lazy, warm day.

On tap at The Burgundian Tavern, pours a clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma of dry grassy hops, some wheat and biscuit - smells nice and crisp. Flavour is nice and dry, with mildly dry grassy hops, a big wheaty component and biscuity malt. Very dry and wheaty. A solid thirst-quenching pilsner. Great stuff.
A dry pilsner style with decent hop, similar to pils typically brewed in the North of Germany.

Tap @ Baileys Taproom...  Poured clear, golden/yellow with a moderate, white-ish head.  Nice lacing.  This was a stellar pilsner.  Floral, bitter, resinous hops up front.  With a bready malt balance and a clean finish.  Could drink this all day.
Draft at stone.  Pours a crystal clear pale gold, with a large white head.  Crisp hops, earthy, crackery malt, grian, and straw.  Light, clean and super easy to drink.  Excellent pilsner.

Tap @ The Forge Foco. Pours a perfectly clear, golden appearance with a white head. Pretty mild, pils malty, straw, a touch earthy, slightly spicy hoppy aroma. Clean, crisp, dry pils malty, hay, light vanilla, grassy, a bit spicy flavor. Refreshing and easy to drink.

Tap at Hops and Pie - Clear gold with a pillowy head - oh hell yes - this is pretty much everything I want from a hoppy American pils - crisp, dry, crackery malt base with a strong mineral bite that arrives just in time to give the strong hop presence something to cling to - hops are grassy and herbal - a light sweetness in the finish - kick ass.

Clear golden with a thin ring of white foam around the edge of the glass. Nose of floral and spicy grassy saaz hops, blonde pilsner malts and some biscuity yeast. The flavor is very pilsner-y with that clear light earthy pale malt, but with a crisp grassy hop overtone, a bit of leafy bitterness, and a dry bready/pilsner finish.
Draught at Choice in Fort Collins. Nice crispy pils with clean flavors. Grassy throughout. Tasty.
This is light and very easy to drink. Has a sharp crips bite with a strong tingly flavor on the tongue. Truly a top-notch pils! Palate score should be a 6.

half-pint from chucks. definitely solid pils without any of the off-putting old penny aromas. in fact, not much aroma at all to speak of. tastes bright and fluffy. I could (and should) drink several of these.
Tap. Pours a clear golden color with white head. Aroma is bread, yeasty, crackers. Taste is more breadiness, some dry roast malt. Very dry yet refreshing. Nice beer for the style.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Pours a clear golden straw color with a tall white head.  The aroma is full of bread and cracker malts with a nice floral, perfumey hop aroma.  A touch of yeast with some apple esters.  Light citrus notes on the back end.  The flavor is quite crisp and refreshing.  Great bread malt sweetness along with a good citrus peel and floral hop profile.  A light bitterness on the finish.  Really easy drinking.

Backlog purge. Growler(s) shared by Sam.

First version: Gold with white head, grassy aroma, mild lemongrass, caramel malty flavor. Finishes dry but still too sweet midpalate.

Second version: Much more classic, crackery malt and much more German tasting. Crisper, allowing better clarity for the hops.

Poured from a tap into am imperial pint glass (20 oz.) at Firestone Walker Brewery in Paso Robles, Calif., on Aug. 9, 2012 for $5.50. One finger of head when I got it that was white and frothy. Lots of bubbles coming up underneath in the middle. Beer color was honey golden pale clear. Lots of foamy retention throughout on the sides and the top. 

Smelled honey, spices (couldnt put my finger on it), hops, cloves, Circus Peanuts, Christmas pine and lemon grass.

Tasted similar to the nose, but had to work for it. Got corn, slight lemon grass, honey, hay and wheat. Maybe a gracious 3.5. 

Light body. Creamy texture. Above average-to-average carbonation. Abrupt clean finish. Crisp, watery and refreshing. 

Very good for a pilsner and a great start for my first Firestone experience (in Paso Robles).

On draft at the Hungry Monk. A light golden pour with a frothy, white head. Almost no aroma at first, with just the slightest bit of fresh grains as the pint warmed. Theres a small initial burst of hops that fades quickly. Finishes very crisp and effervescent with an almost spicy note at the very end. Fairly refreshing on a blazing hot summer day.. Because this was billed as a hoppy pilsener,  it could use just a tad more hop profile.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2013 Tap. Pours clear pale yellow with a medium creamy white head that dissipates slowly with nice lacing. Aroma is grain, grass and floral notes. Taste is quite complex with grass, a spicy note, floral, grain and a light bitter grassy, almost haylike finish. Sharp bite, almost metallic but not unpleasant.
Draft @ Firestone Walker. Clear Pale golden color longlasting white head. Fruity grainy hoppy aroma. Fruity grainy hoppy bitter flavor. Fruity malty hoppy finish.

Draft at FW Night at Urban Family. Great surprise! Clean, gorgeous pale yellow and bubbly white head. Sour hop nose. Big tasty spicy head-clearing lager. Soapy, banana spice and clove. Really tasty and hopped-up. Wish more Pils were like this
At FWIBF, Golden yellow pour with a white head, some yeast and bread on the nose and maybe a touch of hops, taste is light refreshing with some good flavor notes.  Another beer I could drink all day.

Yellow pour at the FW fest.  Nice white head.  Crisp aroma that starts with some bready malts and quickly fades into a nice blend of a yeasty/hoppy profile.  Flavor is smooth and light.  A good hop flavor without crazy bitterness.  Some light grainy malts(in a good way) A very good pils.

Growler.  Clear bright golden straw color with a small white head.  Great aroma with floral notes, hay, and honey.  Nice subtle malt presence, dry and style-fitting.  Medium hop bitterness, very pleasant, floral and hay-like.  Fairly light, crisp, and refreshing.  Elite-level pilsner overall.

Tap at brewpub.  Clear yellow/slight orange in the glass with a nice white head and solid lacing.  Aroma is clean and light floral hops, a bit of a grainy character, and a dry malt backbone.  Taste is as advertised by the aroma with a clean, even hoppiness that dominates the middle.  I really like this beer.  Excellent.

Draft at the brewpub. Nose is grassy hoppiness, white bread yeast, and a hints of caramel malt. Clear gold with a medium, lightly lacing white head. Flavor is moderate bitterness, grainy bread, and a nicely bitter finish. Excellent pilsener!
Growler fill. Clear golden pour with thin white head. Faint bready aroma. Mildly bitter with bready malts. Very crisp and easy to drink.

On tap at the brewery in Paso. Pours with a clear golden body with a thick and lasting white head. Aromas are bready, grainy and grassy. A nice herbal hop presence. Light biscuity and honey malty notes. Clean yeast wise. Flavors are grainy, medium bitter, malty, straw and dry. Hoppy, but it could be a bit stronger on the aromatics and flavors (minor complaint). Medium to lively bubbles, dry, medium crisp. Very easy to drink. Medium to lightly bitter balance that doesnt linger. Medium to light bodied. Nice. Clean and tasty.
